V3 of the Build Service API is experimental and may change at any time. For production applications we recommend using the V2 Build Service API).

API reference

The current version of the API is 3. It has a smaller API interface than v3 for the bundle endpoints, uses a new build system for creating the bundles, and installs the components from npm instead of from Bower.

GET /v3/bundles/js

Fetch a set of components and build a JavaScript bundle.

Param Where? Description
components Querystring A comma separated list of components in the form component@version. component is the name of the component on the npm registry version will be interpreted using SemVer rules and the best matching version will be built.
system_code Querystring The bizops system code for the system which is making the build service request.
callback Querystring (Optional) If present, calls the named javascript function on the window object once the bundle is loaded, with the components object as the first argument.

Due to the expected long duration of the build process, this method may return a redirect to keep the connection alive while the build continues in the background.

The following HTTP errors can be returned:

  • 400 Bad Request: The request was invalid
  • 409 Conflict: There was a dependency conflict in the bundle of components specified
  • 500 Internal Server Error: There was a server error with the build service
  • 560 Compilation Error (non-standard): There was an error compiling the component code, reported from the build tools. This is likely an issue with the component, not with the build service itself

GET /v3/bundles/css

Fetch a set of components and build a CSS bundle.

Param Where Description
components Querystring A comma separated list of components in the form component@version. component is the name of the component on the npm registry version will be interpreted using SemVer rules and the best matching version will be built.
brand Querystring The brand to compile the CSS for. Can be one of master, internal, or whitelabel
system_code Querystring The bizops system code for the system which is making the build service request.

Due to the expected long duration of the build process, this method may return a redirect to keep the connection alive while the build continues in the background.

The following HTTP errors can be returned:

  • 400 Bad Request: The request was invalid
  • 409 Conflict: There was a dependency conflict in the bundle of components specified
  • 500 Internal Server Error: There was a server error with the build service
  • 560 Compilation Error (non-standard): There was an error compiling the component code, reported from the build tools. This is likely an issue with the component, not with the build service itself

GET /v3/font

Fetch a specific font from o-fonts-assets.

Param Where Description
version Querystring The version of o-fonts-assets to use. version will be interpreted using SemVer rules and the best matching version will be used.
file Querystring The path to the file to have returned.
system_code Querystring The bizops system code for the system which is making the build service request.

Due to the expected long duration of downloading from npm, this method may return a redirect to keep the connection alive while the build continues in the background.

The following HTTP errors can be returned:

  • 400 Bad Request: The request was invalid
  • 500 Internal Server Error: There was a server error with the build service

GET /v3/demo

Fetch a specific demo from a component.

Param Where Description
component Querystring A component in the form component@version. component is the name of the component on the npm registry version will be interpreted using SemVer rules and the best matching version will be built.
demo Querystring The name of the demo to have returned.
brand Querystring The brand to compile the demo for. Can be one of master, internal, or whitelabel.
system_code Querystring The bizops system code for the system which is making the build service request.

Due to the expected long duration of downloading from npm, this method may return a redirect to keep the connection alive while the build continues in the background.

The following HTTP errors can be returned:

  • 400 Bad Request: The request was invalid
  • 500 Internal Server Error: There was a server error with the build service
